title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: +1 for this. Its a satire movie, but well done. And they didn't skimp on the sci-fi stuff at the end.
The Shrink Next Door. Paul Rudd surprisingly pulls off a self serving manipulative psychiatrist.
A Polish series called "signs". It is a suspense thriller on Netflix, really good.

Suggest some good foreign cinema or TV show that is other then English and Korean. I'm trying to watch content from different country lately. Last I saw Merlí  a Spanish show, really liked it. I wish there was more content like that out there.
Turkish movie : Miracle in Cell No 7  (remade from a Korean movie i think). It's on Netflix
Arcane, its an adaptation of two characters from the game league of legends. Very successfully done, as the entire production ownership was given to artists.
